p: Over 78–96% of constituents were identified in both ACLEO and ACREO. The major constituents identified in both the oils in all four seasons were trans-methyl isoeugenol, Z-isoelimicin, α-asarone, β-asarone, etc., but with different respective yield. Both ACLEO and ACREO exhibited similar qualitative diversity in terms of terpenoid composition, but their quantity varied in different seasons. However, the constituents, viz., limonene, α-humulene, 2,4,5-trimethoxy benzoic acid, and heptadecanol, could be detected only in ACLEO, whereas elimicin and β-calacorene were detected only in ACREO.
